trans-unit.source: Provides text writer functionality for devices targeted by the HTML adapter set.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Creates a new instance of the specified class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Adapters are usually constructed automatically by ASP.NET and must have a default constructor.
The base writer object.
An object of <xref href="System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities"></xref> class that provides the capability information for the specific device.
Starts a new Style block.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter.EndStyleContext%2A> method to complete the Style block.
Completes a new Style block.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter.BeginStyleContext%2A> method to start the Style block.
Begins a block by using the character formatting from a specified style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style reference.
Begins a block by using the layout and character formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style reference.
Begins a block by using the layout and character formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The EnterStyle and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter.ExitStyle%2A> methods allow a device adapter to emit markup, in order to begin and end a block using the character formatting from a given style.
The style reference.
Ends a block that has been using the character formatting from a specified style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style reference.
Ends a block that has been using the character formatting from a specified style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style reference.
If `breakAfter` is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, a break is added after the closing style element.

Removes the current style, restores the previous style as the current layout style, and optionally calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.WriteEndTag*> method to close the current element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style reference.

Removes the current style, restores the previous style as the current layout style, and optionally calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.WriteEndTag*> method to close the current element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style reference.
If `breakAfter` is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, a break is added after the closing style element.
Ends a block that has been using the layout and character formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style reference.
Ends a block that has been using the layout and character formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style reference.
If `breakAfter` is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, a break is added after the closing style element.
Marks the beginning of a style context.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Indicates whether the body color attribute can be sent to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the body color attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Indicates whether the bold attribute can be sent to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the bold attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Indicates whether the alignment attribute can be sent to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the alignment attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Indicates whether the target device supports the <xref uid="langword_csharp_NoWrap" name="NoWrap" href=""></xref> value for text wrapping.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the target device supports the <xref uid="langword_csharp_NoWrap" name="NoWrap" href=""></xref> value for text wrapping; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Indicates whether the font color attribute can be sent to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the font color attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Indicates whether the font name attribute can be sent to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the font name attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Indicates whether the font size attribute can be sent to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the font size attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Contains a Boolean value that indicates whether to send the <xref uid="langword_csharp_italic" name="italic" href=""></xref> attribute to the target device.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref uid="langword_csharp_italic" name="italic" href=""></xref> attribute can be sent to the target device; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the device does not support HTML <xref uid="langword_csharp_< br >" name="< br >" href=""></xref> elements to format line breaks.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the device does not support HTML <xref uid="langword_csharp_< br >" name="< br >" href=""></xref> tags; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Closes a style context.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Writes the given character to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The character to write to the output stream.
Writes the text to the output stream, along with any pending tab spacing.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text to write to the output stream.
Writes any tab spacing and the opening tag of the specified markup element to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
None
Writes a line break.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Encodes the specified text for the requesting device, and then writes it to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text to encode and write to the output stream.
Writes any tab spacing and the opening tag of the specified markup element to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
None
Writes a hidden field with the given name and value.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A hidden field is in the form \<input type="hidden" name="name" value="value">.
The name of the hidden field.
The value of the hidden field.
Writes a line terminator string to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The line terminator string to write.
Writes the given text, optionally with encoding.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Encoding involves mapping characters with HTML/WML meanings to the appropriate character code.
The text to write.
If <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, encodes the text.
Writes an encoded URL parameter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The parameter is written in the form `name=value`.
The parameter name to encode and write.
The parameter value to encode and write.
